auto_merge.commit_title: Transform constant sequences of C types into C arrays when looping over them (GH-6926)

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
One slight oddity here is that this is now more efficient than

```
for ch in 'a\x0a\N{SNOWMAN}':
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -598,6 +598,43 @@ def loop_over_int_array():
         pass
     return typeof(i)
 
+
+@cython.test_assert_path_exists("//ForFromStatNode")
+@cython.test_fail_if_path_exists("//ForInStatNode")
+def loop_over_character_list():
+    """
+    >>> loop_over_character_list()
+    'Py_UCS4'
+    """
+    for ch in ['a', '\x0a', '\N{SNOWMAN}']:

@@ -598,6 +598,43 @@ def loop_over_int_array():
         pass
     return typeof(i)
 
+
+@cython.test_assert_path_exists("//ForFromStatNode")
+@cython.test_fail_if_path_exists("//ForInStatNode")
+def loop_over_character_list():
+    """
+    >>> loop_over_character_list()
+    'Py_UCS4'
+    """
+    for ch in ['a', '\x0a', '\N{SNOWMAN}']:

commit.message: Transform constant sequences of C types into C arrays when looping over them.
Always apply the array-iter optimisation since it additionally tends to use less code space.
Use existing method instead of duplicating a decision.
Include bytes/unicode literals in C array iteration.
Fix None handling when inferring type of single character sequences.

milestone.description: First feature release after the cleanup releases 3.0 and 3.1.

title: Transform constant sequences of C types into C arrays when looping over them
